1.verse: Paul, a servant of God ( A ) and an apostle ( B ) of Jesus Christ to further the faith of God’s elect and their knowledge of the truth ( C ) that leads to godliness ( D ) —

2.verse: in the hope of eternal life, ( E ) which God, who does not lie, ( F ) promised before the beginning of time, ( G )

3.verse: and which now at his appointed season ( H ) he has brought to light ( I ) through the preaching entrusted to me ( J ) by the command of God ( K ) our Savior, ( L )

4.verse: To Titus, ( M ) my true son ( N ) in our common faith:

5.verse: The reason I left you in Crete ( Q ) was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint  elders ( R ) in every town, as I directed you.

6.verse: An elder must be blameless, ( S ) faithful to his wife, a man whose children believe  and are not open to the charge of being wild and disobedient.

7.verse: Since an overseer ( T ) manages God’s household, ( U ) he must be blameless—not overbearing, not quick-tempered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not pursuing dishonest gain. ( V )

8.verse: Rather, he must be hospitable, ( W ) one who loves what is good, ( X ) who is self-controlled, ( Y ) upright, holy and disciplined.

9.verse: He must hold firmly ( Z ) to the trustworthy message as it has been taught, so that he can encourage others by sound doctrine ( AA ) and refute those who oppose it.

10.verse: For there are many rebellious people, full of meaningless talk ( AB ) and deception, especially those of the circumcision group. ( AC )

11.verse: They must be silenced, because they are disrupting whole households ( AD ) by teaching things they ought not to teach—and that for the sake of dishonest gain.

12.verse: One of Crete’s own prophets ( AE ) has said it: “Cretans ( AF ) are always liars, evil brutes, lazy gluttons.”

13.verse: This saying is true. Therefore rebuke ( AG ) them sharply, so that they will be sound in the faith ( AH )

14.verse: and will pay no attention to Jewish myths ( AI ) or to the merely human commands ( AJ ) of those who reject the truth. ( AK )

15.verse: To the pure, all things are pure, ( AL ) but to those who are corrupted and do not believe, nothing is pure. ( AM ) In fact, both their minds and consciences are corrupted. ( AN )

16.verse: They claim to know God, but by their actions they deny him. ( AO ) They are detestable, disobedient and unfit for doing anything good. ( AP )

1.verse: You, however, must teach what is appropriate to sound doctrine. ( A )

2.verse: Teach the older men ( B ) to be temperate, ( C ) worthy of respect, self-controlled, ( D ) and sound in faith, ( E ) in love and in endurance.

3.verse: Likewise, teach the older women to be reverent in the way they live, not to be slanderers ( F ) or addicted to much wine, ( G ) but to teach what is good.

4.verse: Then they can urge the younger women ( H ) to love their husbands and children,

5.verse: to be self-controlled ( I ) and pure, to be busy at home, ( J ) to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, ( K ) so that no one will malign the word of God. ( L )

6.verse: Similarly, encourage the young men ( M ) to be self-controlled. ( N )

7.verse: In everything set them an example ( O ) by doing what is good. ( P ) In your teaching show integrity, seriousness

8.verse: and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us. ( Q )

9.verse: Teach slaves to be subject to their masters in everything, ( R ) to try to please them, not to talk back to them,

10.verse: and not to steal from them, but to show that they can be fully trusted, so that in every way they will make the teaching about God our Savior ( S ) attractive. ( T )

11.verse: For the grace ( U ) of God has appeared ( V ) that offers salvation to all people. ( W )

12.verse: It teaches us to say “No” to ungodliness and worldly passions, ( X ) and to live self-controlled, ( Y ) upright and godly lives ( Z ) in this present age,

13.verse: while we wait for the blessed hope—the appearing ( AA ) of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ, ( AB )

14.verse: who gave himself for us ( AC ) to redeem us from all wickedness ( AD ) and to purify ( AE ) for himself a people that are his very own, ( AF ) eager to do what is good. ( AG )

15.verse: These, then, are the things you should teach. Encourage and rebuke with all authority. Do not let anyone despise you.

1.verse: Remind the people to be subject to rulers and authorities, ( A ) to be obedient, to be ready to do whatever is good, ( B )

2.verse: to slander no one, ( C ) to be peaceable and considerate, and always to be gentle toward everyone.

3.verse: At one time ( D ) we too were foolish, disobedient, deceived and enslaved by all kinds of passions and pleasures. We lived in malice and envy, being hated and hating one another.

4.verse: But when the kindness ( E ) and love of God our Savior ( F ) appeared, ( G )

5.verse: he saved us, ( H ) not because of righteous things we had done, ( I ) but because of his mercy. ( J ) He saved us through the washing ( K ) of rebirth and renewal ( L ) by the Holy Spirit,

6.verse: whom he poured out on us ( M ) generously through Jesus Christ our Savior,

7.verse: so that, having been justified by his grace, ( N ) we might become heirs ( O ) having the hope ( P ) of eternal life. ( Q )

8.verse: This is a trustworthy saying. ( R ) And I want you to stress these things, so that those who have trusted in God may be careful to devote themselves to doing what is good. ( S ) These things are excellent and profitable for everyone.

9.verse: But avoid ( T ) foolish controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels ( U ) about the law, ( V ) because these are unprofitable and useless. ( W )

10.verse: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn them a second time. After that, have nothing to do with them. ( X )

11.verse: You may be sure that such people are warped and sinful; they are self-condemned.

12.verse: As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus ( Y ) to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, because I have decided to winter there. ( Z )

13.verse: Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos ( AA ) on their way and see that they have everything they need.

14.verse: Our people must learn to devote themselves to doing what is good, ( AB ) in order to provide for urgent needs and not live unproductive lives.

15.verse: Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet those who love us in the faith. ( AC )
